Detailed Description

Factory class for ObexBuffers with user-defined memory manangement strategy.

Applications or OBEX implementations which want to implement their own buffer management strategy (for example, to make use of static buffers provided by a protocol stack) should derive from this class and implement the Create() and OnDestroy() methods accordingly.

void ObexBuffer::Factory::Destroy (  ObexBuffer &  buffer  ) 
 

Destroys object previously created by the factory.

Calling destroy takes the ownership of the managed data buffer from the ObexBuffer and, by invoking OnRelease(), passes the internal data buffer back to the factory which should know how to handle it (perhaps nothing, in case of a static buffer, or kepping it in an internal free-list.

Parameters:
ObexBuffer to be recycled.

virtual void ObexBuffer::Factory::OnRelease (  DataPtr  user_ptr,
Size  capacity
)  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Returns an internal data buffer to the factory.

See also:
Destroy()
Parameters:
user_ptr Pointer to the internal buffer
capacity Size of the buffer to be returned
If any cleanup action is required in order to avoid a resource leak, it must be triggered from within this method. It is invoked directly after the ObexBuffer being deleted has released ownership of user_ptr.
